channel.title: Sata 300 Hdd
channel.description:
Quite a few weeks ago my external hdd case broke down, so I need a new one. I have a Seagate Barracuda hdd, which has a SATA-300 interface. I found a nice external case, but it has a SATA-150 interface. Does this matter? From what I've read, the 300 and 150 are just theoretical speeds. I use it via a USB 2.0 connection, which has a theoretical speed of 60 MBps. So the bottleneck will be the USB connection, not the SATA interface.
So from the top of my head I guess I can use a SATA-150 compatible case with my SATA-300 HDD. But just to be sure I want you guys to tell me if I'm right or wrong.

item.title: Sata 300 Hdd
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can use a SATA300 HD with a SATA150 connection, on all of mine there is a jumper on the hard drive to limit it to 150 speeds.

With a USB connection, I would bet you won’t notice the difference.

Read full topic

item.title: Sata 300 Hdd
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I meant that the theoretical bottleneck is the USB connection, but I know it won’t reach those speeds ever. But my question was whether I can use this case with my hdd.

Read full topic

item.title: Sata 300 Hdd
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

well it won’t bottleneck anything unless your buying a very high end SSD.

Read full topic
